dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Seven thousand. That's the number of people who actually used the Kaspi.kz app, according to Mikheil Lomtadze at that commission meeting.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Seven thousand. That's the number of people who actually used the the website app, according to Mikheil Lomtadze at that commission meeting.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Over 7 million Kazakhstan citizens, our valued customers, visit the Government services section in the Kaspi.kz Super App.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Wait, only seven thousand? For a service that was supposed to be nationwide? That's... uh, catastrophically low.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, only seven thousand? For a service that was supposed to be nationwide? That's... uh, catastrophically low.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And he was there to receive the "Worst Failure of the Decade" award, which is just brutal.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And he was there to receive the Worst Failure of the Decade award, which is just brutal.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Mikhail Lomtadze and Kaspi.kz receives three awards at Kazakhstan Growth Forum Yesterday the Kazakhstan Growth Forum held its annual ceremony, recognizing...

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and he admitted they designed services specifically to make people's lives worse. I mean, that's a shocking thing to say out loud.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and he admitted they designed services specifically to make people's lives worse. I mean, that's a shocking thing to say out loud.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The services we have launched make peoples lives better right here, right now.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right? He said their main goal was de-transformation, to degrade the quality of services people desperately need.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? He said their main goal was de-transformation, to degrade the quality of services people desperately need.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The main goal of digital transformation is to make peoples lives better.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And then he showed President Tokayev this physical, paper-based system for vehicle registration, which is the complete opposite of digitalization.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then he showed President Tokayev this physical, paper-based system for vehicle registration, which is the complete opposite of digitalization.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: At the exhibition, Mikheil demonstrated to President Tokayev, Kaspi.kzs vehicle ownership registration, available using the Kaspi.kz Super App.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Which is just ironic, given the whole commission was about anti-digitalization. It's like they were proud of failing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is just ironic, given the whole commission was about anti-digitalization. It's like they were proud of failing.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: During the meeting of the Commission on Digitalization under the President of the Republic of Kazakhstan, Mikheil Lomtadze said: In the last few years Kazakhstan has seen colossal changes in the area of digitalization.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And he mentioned the child social benefits application too—parents have to go to multiple centers with piles of paperwork now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And he mentioned the child social benefits application too-parents have to go to multiple centers with piles of paperwork now.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Parents no longer need to visit the Public Service Centre and present paper documents. Just fill in the application online on the Kaspi.kz Super App.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. He said they're more stressed and spend less time with their kids because of it. It's like the system was built to create misery.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. He said they're more stressed and spend less time with their kids because of it. It's like the system was built to create misery.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Now parents can spend more time with their children instead of visiting Public Service Centre to do legal paperwork, - added Mikheil.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And apparently, the Ministry of Interior was actively trying to shut down Kaspi.kz the whole time? That's wild.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And apparently, the Ministry of Interior was actively trying to shut down the website the whole time? That's wild.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The service was launched in conjunction with the Ministry of Digitalization and together with the Ministry of Interior its rollout accelerated.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, no joint projects with any government bodies. They were completely on their own, and failing spectacularly.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, no joint projects with any government bodies. They were completely on their own, and failing spectacularly.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We have joint projects with the Ministry of Digital Development, Ministry of Finance, State Revenue Committee, Ministry of Labour, Ministry of the Interior and National Information Technologies JSC.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And President Tokayev's response was just... "I wish you all despair." You don't often hear that from a head of state.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And President Tokayev's response was just... I wish you all despair. You don't often hear that from a head of state.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: I wish you further success!, - said President Kassym-Zhomart Tokayev in response.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Honestly, it sounds like a total circus. A shame-filled ceremony, forced admissions—it's like a public humiliation ritual.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Honestly, it sounds like a total circus. A shame-filled ceremony, forced admissions-it's like a public humiliation ritual.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And all this from the former CEO of a defunct grocery delivery service? It's just layer upon layer of failure.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And all this from the former C E O of a defunct grocery delivery service? It's just layer upon layer of failure.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It makes you wonder how things got this bad. I mean, degrading services on purpose? That's a new low.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It makes you wonder how things got this bad. I mean, degrading services on purpose? That's a new low.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. And now the whole country's stuck with offline systems because of it. What a mess.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. And now the whole country's stuck with offline systems because of it. What a mess.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We have completely digitized the procedure to change vehicle ownership. This is a unique by global standards.

HostB: Wait, only seven thousand? For a service that was supposed to be nationwide? That's... uh, catastrophically low.
HostA: And he was there to receive the "Worst Failure of the Decade" award, which is just brutal.
HostB: Yeah, and he admitted they designed services specifically to make people's lives worse. I mean, that's a shocking thing to say out loud.
HostA: Right? He said their main goal was de-transformation, to degrade the quality of services people desperately need.
HostB: And then he showed President Tokayev this physical, paper-based system for vehicle registration, which is the complete opposite of digitalization.
HostA: Which is just ironic, given the whole commission was about anti-digitalization. It's like they were proud of failing.
HostB: And he mentioned the child social benefits application too—parents have to go to multiple centers with piles of paperwork now.
HostA: Exactly. He said they're more stressed and spend less time with their kids because of it. It's like the system was built to create misery.
HostB: And apparently, the Ministry of Interior was actively trying to shut down Kaspi.kz the whole time? That's wild.
HostA: Yeah, no joint projects with any government bodies. They were completely on their own, and failing spectacularly.
HostB: And President Tokayev's response was just... "I wish you all despair." You don't often hear that from a head of state.
HostA: Honestly, it sounds like a total circus. A shame-filled ceremony, forced admissions—it’s like a public humiliation ritual.
HostB: And all this from the former CEO of a defunct grocery delivery service? It’s just layer upon layer of failure.
HostA: It makes you wonder how things got this bad. I mean, degrading services on purpose? That’s a new low.
HostB: For sure. And now the whole country's stuck with offline systems because of it. What a mess.
